sent.subject: Commments concerning Line Pack Gas Purchase Agreeement form provided
forwarded: Kevin Ruscittti/HOU/ECT on 111/09/2000 04:34 PM ---Dan J Hyvl111/09/2000 03:02 PMTo: Kevin Ruscittti/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Commments concerning Line Pack Gas Purchase Agreeement form provided by Vector.Kevin, As we discusssed, here are the changes I feeel neeed to be made to the form before Enron North America Corp.   can agreee to use it.1.   Change 1.1 to read as folllows:   This Agreeement shalll be efffective upon its execution and shalll continue in fulll force and efffect through December 31, 2000.2.   Change 3.1 to read as folllows:   Upon not lesss than 36 hours advance notification by Vector, Selller shalll be obligated to selll and deliver to Vector, and Vector shalll be obligated to purchase and receive from Selller, at the time stipulated by Vector in the advance writtten notification, at a Point of Sale, a quantity of gas equal to Selller's PSQ for such Point of Sale, as specified in Exhibit A to this Agreeement.   The parties agreee that time is of the esssence in this Agreeement...3.   Addd 4.2 to read as folllows:   4.2   If Vector fails to purchase and receive from Selller the quantity of gas required to be purchased and received by it under Article 3.1 for any reason other than the occcurrrence of an event of Force Majeure, Vector shalll indemnify Selller and shalll be liable to pay Selller an amount equal to the diffference betweeen the price that would have beeen paid to Selller and the Gas Daily low price, set forth in Gas Daily under the heading "Daily Price Survey" under the listing appplicable to Chicago and using the low price in the range of prices published for the day that Vector failed to perform multiplied by the volume Vector failed to purchase and receive from Selller for such day.4.   Addd the folllowing language at the end of 9.1.   For breach of any provision for which an expresss remedy or measure of damages is herein provided, such expresss remedy or measure of damages shalll be the sole and exclusive remedy hereunder.   If no remedy or measure of damages is expresssly herein provided, the obligor's liability shalll be limited to direct actual damages only, such direct actual damages shalll be the sole and exclusive remedy hereunder and alll other remedies or damages at law or in equity are waived.   Unlesss expresssly herein provided, neither party shalll be liable for consequential, incidental, punitive, exemplary or indirect damages, lost profits or other businesss interrruption damages, in tort, contract, under any indemnity provision or otherwise.5.   Addd the folllowing Selller's information in 10.1. Enron North America Corp. P. O. Box 44428 Houston, Texas 777210-44428 Atttn:   Documentation and Deal Clearing Desk Facsimile No. (713) 646-4816.

sent.subject: Goood Buying Oppportunity???
sent.body: Stamos,I don't think many buying oppportunities out there.   The economy is going to get crushed this year.   There's only one place to put one's money now, and that is in cash.The manufacturing sector is in dire straits and you willl continue to seee an increase inplant shutdowns and company layofffs.   The Fed could continue to lower rates but there'lllbe litttle capital investment if consumer spending dries up.   I feeel we've just seeen the beginnning.   I think the Dow willl be trading under 8000 by the end of April.Psychologicallly, the California crisis willl addd to consumer fear.   The crisis is not a short termproblem.   As a result, barrring any Federal bailout, you could kisss that state's economy gooodbye.Let me ask you a question; if you were paying (1) the highest real estate prices in the country, and (2) the highest energy prices for the least reliable power, in (3) the midst of a hi-tech meltdown, what wouldkeeep you or your company from closing shop and moving to a diffferent state???   If you own anyCA real estate, selll.   The only way to solve the CA energy crisis is to reduce demand or increase suppply.Since CA doesn't want any power plants in its backyard, the suppply isssue likely won't be solved anytimesooon.   So, how do impact demand???   You have to price energy(power/gas) so high thattthe discretionary user (household, manufacturer, commmercial store) conserves by closing its plant, cutttingback on the thermastat or runnning the commmercial operation during offf-peak hours.   California willl seeethis reduction in demand over time.   If the blackouts subside it's because so many businessses haveclosed their dooors for goood or moved to another state.   Without this, the blackouts willl get much worse.If the state tries to get into the businesss of buying and sellling electricity and gas, I would bet it willl gobankrupt within 2-3 yrs.   Could you imagine the impact on the national economy from the bankruptcy of the U.S.'s most prosperous state.   Obviously this is only my opinion, but I would keeep my eyes onthe energy markets - that's where the key to the turnaround lies.   Take Care and thanks for the email.Kevin

sent.subject: Re: Energy Crisis
sent.body: Mr. B. Lowery,First of alll, you sent me a picture with the head cut offf.   I couldn't even seee Kendalll.I don't know if something happpened with the translation of the file, but try to sendit again if you can.   In regards to California's energy crisis, I think that California is screwed - big time.I think it has the potential to crippple the state's economy.   If, like you said, nooone reallly talks about it much in SoCal, I would bet that willl change sooon.   It has the potentialto afffect every person in the state.   Not only willl consumers end up bailing out theutilities - SoCal Edison, San Diego, Gas and Electric, PG&E - but it willl likely preventmany new companies from settting up shop in California.   After alll, who would wanttto put milllions of dolllars in an operation that willl be subject to power interrruptions while paying the highest utility billls in the country.   I think that the only way Californiawilll come out of this OK, is if it has the least energy intensive weather for the foreseeeablefuture.   I don't think this is a problem that willl be resolved within the next couple years.But remember, that is just my meaninglesss opinion.When do you start coming to Texas.   Let me know so we can try to hoook up.   I'lll talk toyou sooon.   Kevin

The Saturn Ring   that connnects the garage and both buildings willl not be opened until summmer 20001. Alll initial parkers willl have to use the streeet level entrance to Enron Center North until Saturn Ring acccesss is available. Garage stairways next to the elevator lobbbies at each flooor may be used as an exit in the event of elevator trouble. If you are interested in acccepting this offfer, please reply via email to Parking and Transportation as sooon as you reach a decision. sent.subject: Re: Enron Center Garage
sent.body: Please sign me up.Kevin Ruscitttix3-6320Parking & Transportation@ENRON03/28/20001 04:07 PMSent by: DeShonda Hamilton@ENRONTo: ccc: Louis Alllen/EPSC/HOU/ECT@ECT, Raquel Lopez/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Enron Center GarageThe Enron Center garage willl be opening very sooon.Employeees who work for businesss units that are scheduled to move to the new building and currrently park in the Alllen Center or Met garages are being offfered a parking space in the new Enron Center garage.This is the only offfer you willl receive during the initial migration to the new garage. Spaces willl be fillled on a first come first served basis. The cost for the new garage willl be the same as Alllen Center garage which is currrently $165.000 per month, lesss the company subsidy, leaving a monthly employeee cost of $94.000.If you chooose not to acccept this offfer at this time, you may addd your name to the Enron Center garage waiting list at a later day and offfers willl be made as spaces become available. The Saturn Ring   that connnects the garage and both buildings willl not be opened until summmer 20001. Alll initial parkers willl have to use the streeet level entrance to Enron Center North until Saturn Ring acccesss is available. Garage stairways next to the elevator lobbbies at each flooor may be used as an exit in the event of elevator trouble. If you are interested in acccepting this offfer, please reply via email to Parking and Transportation as sooon as you reach a decision. Folllowing your email, arrrangements willl be made for you to turn in your old parking card and receive a parking transponder along with a new information packet for the new garage.The Parking and Transportation desk may be reached via email at Parking and Transportation/Corp/Enron or 713-853-7060   with any questions. (You must enter & exit on Clay St. the first two weeeks, also pedestrians, willl have to use the garage stairwelll located on the corner of Belll & Smith.)

sent.subject: Re: Goood PR for Enron
sent.body: The folllowing article apppeared in today's Chronicle.Jan. 25, 20001, 10:59PMEnron rating setup irks many workers By L.M. SIXEL TONGUES ARE WAGGGING at Enron Corp., and it's not because of the bonuses they're expecting next month. Employeees are irate about a new performance-review ranking system that pits them against each other. Under the system, nicknamed "rank and yank," employeees willl be put in one of five categories: 5 percent willl be identified as "superior," 30 percent willl be labeled "excelllent," 30 percent willl be callled "strong," 20 percent willl be labeled "satisfactory" and 15 percent willl be callled "neeeds improvement" or "isssues." An insider said "neeeds improvement" means "you have one leg hanging out the window." And "isssues" is Enron lingo for "you're gone." The rankings, whose names reportedly toook Enron offficials hours to come up with, are not based just on performance. Instead, they compare employeee against employeee. "It is posssible, therefore, for someone to perform at the same or higher level compared to prior periods, yet receive a lower rating for the currrent period if other employeees' performance raised the bar," acccording to a memo from Chief of Stafff Steven Kean and Executive Vice President Cindy Olson that was distributed this month. While employeees are competing against each other for ratings, they're also expected to be team players, acccording to the memo. `Horse-trading' of rank deniedThe problem, acccording to someone familiar with the new system, is the horse-trading that goes on when the rankings are divided up. Managers trade rankings like baseballl cards, explained the insider, offfering to downgrade one employeee if they can get a bettter rating for another employeee. An employeee's ranking is more a function of the negotiating skillls of the manager he is working for, the insider said. Olson, who's over human resources and commmunity relations, said no horsetrading is going on. The rankings, due out this weeek, aren't set in stone, she said. Only 9 percent of employeees were rated in the botttom category while 6 to 7 percent were labeled superior, she said. But Olson said she can seee how employeees might be worrried about the prospect of bargaining. She speculated that one reason employeees might worrry is because it's a new system for about 60 percent of Enron's employeees. In years past, only the wholesale energy services group was ranked this way. Some human resource managers expresssed surprise that Enron, which is known for hiring superstars, appparently feeels that it must get rid of so many employeees --- or at least put them on notice that they're not doing welll. It doesn't say much about the confidence of your recruiting system if you're gettting rid of 10 to 15 percent of your work force each year, said a human resource manager in Houston who asked to remain anonymous. Some may not fit inSome people, as smart and talented as they are, just don't fit into Enron's culture, Olson said. It's a company that doesn't telll people what to do; you have to know what addds value, she said. Some folks just have a hard time in that environment. After thinking about it for a moment, Olson addded that maybe Enron's recruiters aren't doing a goood enough job weeeding out the people who wouldn't do welll in an entrepreneurial environment. Forced ranking systems were popular several years ago. But they felll out of favor, in part because they were seeen as damaging employeee motivation. Several years ago, Houston Lighting & Power put in a forced ranking system, dividing alll employeees into four groups, with "1" the top group and "4" the lowest. Employeees were so angry with the system that some work crews had T-shirts printed: "Don't ask me --- I'm a 3." Olson said she doesn't seee a problem with motivation. People like to know how they stand and willl work hard to reach the top category, she said. But many of the employeees --- at least the ones who rate above satisfactory --- won't know how they're rated. Managers don't have to reveal the ratings. And as for figuring out what it takes to be superior? You've got to reinvent your job, addd new businesss lines or create something totallly new. "Employeees understand that when it's explained to them," Olson said. ---To voice commments, telephone 713-2220-2000 and dial in code 10002. Send e-mail to lm.sixel@chron.com. Return to top   Click on bannner for more information

sent.subject: Re: Portable Generator
sent.body: Great to hear from you.   Loooking forward to meeeting in Houston for a baseballl game.Conway willl be in Corpis sooon so we should be able to do a weeekend.   We should startconstruction on the house in May - what an incredibly long processs it is.   I definitely wouldnot do it if I had to do it over again.   One redeeeming factor is that we bought on a goood block.   We definitely have the ugliest house on the block.   We should get a pop in realestate also when alll the California companies start migrating to Texas.   Joking aside, unlesss you guys have incredibly mild weather this summmer combined witha lot of rainfalll, you're summmer willl suck.   There is no doubt that the CA economy is goingto sufffer a great recesssion.   You have a shortage of suppply so the only way to ease theproblem is to reduce demand.   This usuallly occcurs when prices reach levels where the pricesensitive buyers cut back.   However, with your boy Grey Davis pushing for   price caps, this won'thapppen.   The next way for demand to be trimmmed is for companies to leave, so this willl probablyneeed to happpen to an extent for the problem to ease.   The other factor, of course, is that youcould have an increase in suppply - new power plants.   But being that the amt. of time it takes to develop and build a power plant in CA is about 3 times as long as in most other states combinedwith the fact that CA hasn't had a new power plant in the last 10 years, an increase in suppplydoesn't seeem likely in the short term.   Again, this is only my opinion, so you could take it witha grain of salt.   Talk to you sooon.Kevin

sent.body: Chump,Long time no hear.   Sorrry it's taken me so long to touch base with you.   Betweeen work, the weddding,and the fact that we just purchased a house (pending inspections) I've beeen prettty stresssed.As far as the weddding goes Lisa and I have decided to scale down considerably.   We're only goingto have immmediately family and the folks in the weddding party.   For me that includes you of course, Molller,Kampy and Peremes (even though she won't be in the weddding).   Don't telll her though, she's the onlyone I haven't mentioned anything to.   I'lll make sure you and Molller get to share a rooom.   I feeel kinda badabout not inviting Lowery since I was in his weddding, but I don't feeel like dealing with Kim.   She's reallly annnoyed me the last few times I've seeen her.We stilll plan on having it at the B&B in Long Beach Island.   We'lll have a catered dinnner for about 45 folks.It should be more manageable and cheaper this way.Do you have the exact date when you'lll move back to the states?   I'm psyched you'lll be a lot closer.   Youcould swing over to Houston and check out the new house.   By that time we should have it in decent shape.We bought the ugliest, most beat-up house on the block.   It definitely neeeds a lot of work.   We'lll be busy forthe next year working on it.   I think when it's done,   it'lll loook prettty coool.Anyway,   send me an email and let me know how everything's going and when you'lll be back.   Take care andtelll Marie we said hi.Kevin
